required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Metabolic Effects of Breaks in Sedentary Time
clinical_study.official_title: The Metabolic Effects of Breaks in Sedentary Time

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether acute bouts of sedentary behaviour (with or without breaks and/or structured physical activity) result in measurable changes in metabolic health in children and youth.

detailed_description.textblock: North American children spend the majority of their waking hours engaging in sedentary behavior (e.g. sitting). Research in adults and animal models suggests that even short bouts of uninterrupted siting may result in acute changes increases in cardiometabolic risk, although to date no studies have investigated this relationship in children and youth. The purpose of this study is to assess the feasibility of a protocol which will expose participants aged 10-14 years to a full day of uninterrupted sitting, and to determine the impact of this protocol on markers of cardiometabolic risk (insulin, glucose, triglyceride, HDL-C and LDL-C) as well as subsequent food intake and physical activity. The impact of uninterrupted sitting will be compared to the impact of interrupted sitting, with and without the inclusion of moderate physical activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Insulin Net Incremental Area-Under-The-Curve (iAUC)
primary_outcome.description: Insulin levels will be assessed multiple times throughout the day, and the resulting values will be used to calculate AUC.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Triglyceride Net Incremental Area-Under-The-Curve (iAUC)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood draws will be taken several times throughout the day, and the resulting values will be used to calculate AUC.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in HDL-Cholesterol (HDL-C) Net Incremental Area-Under-The-Curve (iAUC)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood draws will occur throughout the day, and the resulting values will be used to calculate AUC.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in LDL-Cholesterol (LDL-C) Net Incremental Area-Under-The-Curve (iAUC)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood draws will occur throughout the day, and the resulting values will be used to calculate AUC.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Glucose Net Incremental Area-Under-The-Curve (iAUC)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood draws will occur throughout the day, and the resulting values will be used to calculate AUC.

arm_group.description: In this condition, participants will engage in 8 hours of uninterrupted sedentary behaviour.

In this condition participants will engage in 8 hours of sitting, although the sitting will be interrupted every 20 minutes. During these interruptions participants will spend 2 minutes walking at an intensity equivalent to 30% of VO2peak.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Sedentary With Breaks and Physical Activity
arm_group.description: In this condition participants will engage in 8 hours of sitting, although the sitting will be interrupted every 20 minutes. During these interruptions participants will spend 2 minutes walking at an intensity equivalent to 30% of VO2peak. Participants will also engage in 20 minutes of structured physical activity at an intensity of 60% of VO2peak in both the morning and afternoon.

intervention.description: In this condition, participants will engage in 8 hours of uninterrupted sedentary behaviour.

In this condition participants will engage in 8 hours of sitting, although the sitting will be interrupted every 20 minutes. During these interruptions participants will spend 2 minutes walking at an intensity equivalent to 30% of VO2peak.

intervention.intervention_name: Sedentary With Breaks and Physical Activity
intervention.description: In this condition participants will engage in 8 hours of sitting, although the sitting will be interrupted every 20 minutes. During these interruptions participants will spend 2 minutes walking at an intensity equivalent to 30% of VO2peak. Participants will also engage in 20 minutes of structured physical activity at an intensity of 60% of VO2peak in both the morning and afternoon.
intervention.arm_group_label: Sedentary With Breaks and Physical Activity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 10-14
- Normal weight or obese
Exclusion Criteria:
- Overweight
- Overt diabetes or heart disease (or taking medications to treat this conditions)
- Being unambulatory or otherwise unable to perform the study protocol

overall_official.affiliation: Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario Research Institute

facility.name: Behavioural Metabolic Research Unit, University of Ottawa

results_reference.citation: Saunders TJ, Chaput JP, Goldfield GS, Colley RC, Kenny GP, Doucet E, Tremblay MS. Prolonged sitting and markers of cardiometabolic disease risk in children and youth: a randomized crossover study. Metabolism. 2013 Oct;62(10):1423-8. doi: 10.1016/j.metabol.2013.05.010. Epub 2013 Jun 15.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Dr Mark Tremblay, Director, Healthy Active Living and Obesity Research Group

group.title: Sed, Sed With Breaks, Sed With Breaks and PA
group.description: In this condition, participants experienced the experimental conditions in the following order. Each condition was separated by at least 1 week. Sedentary condition Sedentary with breaks condition Sedentary with breaks and physical activity condition

group.title: Sed, Sed With Breaks and PA, Sed With Breaks
group.description: In this condition, participants experienced the experimental conditions in the following order. Each condition was separated by at least 1 week. Sedentary condition Sedentary with breaks and physical activity condition Sedentary with breaks condition

group.title: Sed With Breaks, Sed With Breaks and PA, Sed
group.description: In this condition, participants experienced the experimental conditions in the following order. Each condition was separated by at least 1 week. Sedentary with breaks and physical activity condition Sedentary with breaks condition Sedentary condition

group.title: Sed With Breaks, Sed, Sed With Breaks and PA
group.description: In this condition, participants experienced the experimental conditions in the following order. Each condition was separated by at least 1 week. Sedentary with breaks condition Sedentary condition Sedentary with breaks and physical activity condition

group.title: Sed With Breaks and PA, Sed, Sed With Breaks
group.description: In this condition, participants experienced the experimental conditions in the following order. Each condition was separated by at least 1 week. Sedentary with breaks and physical activity condition Sedentary condition Sedentary with breaks condition

group.title: Sed With Breaks and PA, Sed With Breaks, Sed
group.description: In this condition, participants experienced the experimental conditions in the following order. Each condition was separated by at least 1 week. Sedentary with breaks and physical activity condition Sedentary with breaks condition Sedentary condition

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: All participants experienced all 3 conditions, in random order.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: Body Mass Index calculated using height and weight
Pubertal stage measured by self-reported Tanner stage
measure.description: Tanner stages are a scale of physical development in children, adolescents and adults. The scale ranges from 1 (pre-pubescent child) to 5 (adult), and defines physical measurements of development based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics, such as the size of the breasts, genitals, testicular volume and development of pubic hair.

measure.title: Baseline PA level by Actical Accelerometer
Baseline Sedentary Behaviour by Actical Accelerometer

outcome.description: Insulin levels will be assessed multiple times throughout the day, and the resulting values will be used to calculate AUC.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
